On the first point, I'll admit that was hastily written. About your question, I'd define utility as "everything that isn't about directly making hp bars go up or down faster or slower". That means everything accept Damage, Heals and Shield and damage amplification (And posssibly damage buff). I guess you could argue about a gapcloser... But that's irevelent for now.

Anyway, what I meant is that Q/powerQ and W  are basically straight skills. powerW I'm not sure, it's not damage/heal, but It's straight defense (or damage reduction in this case). Mostly non intereactive and unidimentionnal. I'm not sure.
E and R are a ms buff and soft-CC and a CC. They have no other uses (other than damage). All those, I'd call utility. 
You mention I'm understating what her skills do, but now that I've explained myself, do I still understate what they do?

About the "soft vs hard" utility. It was me improvising words. I was drawing a parrallel between a soft CC  and hard CC. A soft CC is one that leaves some possibilities to the opponent while a hard just completely nullifies teh opponent. The same way, a soft utility would be one that doesn't completely changes the game (ms buff, the smallish wall of thresh's ult) while a hard utility would be one that radically changes the playing field (walls, dashes, grabs, complete zone control (like Azir's ult or tower)).
I'll admit I made this distinction on the spot, I know it's totally unofficial.

added : In leona's case, I considered her very long range ult as "utility" since she can do it from really far outside the fight basically making pseudo-global range a form of utility. Now that I reread it, I'm not quite sure it makes sense.

Let's clear some things up, because this thread has kind of gotten out of hand with people throwing random thoughts with little basis in reality in regards to this champion.

I'm going to use two classes of supports to compare Sona to. AP casters (Annie, Karma, Zyra, Nami, Janna, Lulu, Vel'Koz, Morgana, Soraka, and even Zilean despite the fact nobody plays him anymore anyways), and the rest (Alistar, Blitzcrank, Leona, Thresh, Braum, and Taric). I've excluded niche supports for obvious reasons.

In comparison to ALL other supports:
Only Zyra has lower base HP
Sona is tied with 4 other supports with 325 (The lowest possible) base movement speed
She also has THE weakest heal, base and scaling.
The second weakest shield, base and scaling. Only Thresh's is lower base, but that is still an AoE shield, infinitely scaling, with the teammate saving component as well.
The LOWEST amount of CC pre level 6. This might be debatable compared to Zilean, but he doesn't require using another part of his kit like Sona does to actually utilize the CC. I'm referring to her passive. 
Only Annie, Zyra, Vel'Koz, Morgana have lower mobility in terms of skills, and those flaws are supplemented in their insane amounts of CC and AP ratios. There's a reason why you don't see AP Sona mid anymore.

Compared to AP casters: 
The weakest AP ratios across the board. P 20%, Q 50%/20% for on hit Aura effect, W 20% Heal, 30% max heal, 20% Shield, R 50%. There are some more % per AP ratios on her W and E but those are still rather laughable, considering Sona shouldn't build AP anyways with her other trashy ratios. 

Compared to the rest:
Yeah try poking these f'ers out of lane. Getting caught by one ability from any of them is almost guaranteed death, and considering her HP and Move speed, getting caught is actually REALLY easy.

To those of you who say that her win rate is still high: Yeah I've actually got nothing. I don't know why her win rate is high. Maybe us Sona mains are just smarter than the rest of you. But that's not true, because we still play her. 

Kidding on that last part, but I'm a Sona main. Or at least I was. I haven't played her since this last set of nerfs, which mark the ninth straight set of nerfs for the champion without meaningful buffs. I'm still a sucker for punishment and will be getting this skin, but I won't play her in ranked until she gets some serious changes. 

Riot has decided to nerf her strengths in her AP ratios and AoE healing.  Having a healing ability that only gets strong when a teammate is dangerously close to death, with a maximum cool down of 6 seconds (W CDR is 10 at all ranks, 6 seconds assumes 40% CDR) is a joke. You literally have to wait until the fight is almost over, compared to Soraka who can literally heal an ADC to 100% 3 times over in the span it takes Sona to to it once, if that.


Her ability CDs are too high for what little effect they have. The only redeeming quality in her kit is her passive. And by that I mean Power Chord W. At base, it is literally half an exhaust. 

Tl;dr Read the above paragraph. Sona's in a really bad place right now. I used to consider myself a Sona main. I used to play her AP mid, AP support, Utility support, and even tried her as ADC a couple times. All to much success. With her trash AP ratios, punishing CDR, GARBAGE base stats, and overall mediocre state, I haven't been able to touch her in ranked play. I'm a sucker for punishment and will still get this skin, but I don't accept this 'shiny!' ultimate skin to change how I feel about her.

This . So much this.

Compared to Thresh, there is very few reasons to pick Sona besides to maybe enjoy her cool ult animation.

Thresh does everything Sona can do and hope to do, except he does it better.

- He can engage.
- He can disengage.
- He can peel.
- He has superior poke.
- He has superior cc.
- Superior presence in lane.
- One of the best peels in the game (Lantern).

Why would anyone pick Sona over Thresh? Or Sona over Leona, Annie, Braum, it's a joke.

If you limit the comparisons to champions that are actually strong META picks (Basically exclude Zyra and Zilean), Sona gets outclassed by every single champion in every phase of the game. I honestly think the only reason why her win rate is high is because she's pretty brainless. No actual need to aim anything other than her Ultimate. If you actually hit your Crescendo, it's pretty much a green light for your team to go in and do shit. Like "HERE THEY ARE, ATTACK". This kind of kit requires very delicate balancing, and we've seen how strong Sona can be. In addition to everything else, she's extremely awkward to itemize, often wasting gold potential on overcapped CDR items and any AP if you're thick enough to believe that AP bar.  I understand she fits the niche of "brainless champion," but I'd be more than willing to sacrifice some of her ease of play in favor of an actual reason to play her.

Lets also not forget that Nami does basically what Sona can do, except again in every way better.

They are in many ways the same champion, except Nami synergizes SO FUCKING GOOD with a poke ADC (Cait, Ezreal) and can peel nicely while also having great disengage and engage with her ultimate.

Some of the comparisons of Sona to other champions look biased. Like comparing Sona's healing to Soraka isn't fair because Soraka is all about her healing, but she lacks immediate hard cc and ally ms boost.

Btw, I'm not saying Sona is overpowered/underpowered. Just wanted to say some comparisons aren't very accurate.

It's a very fair point, but let's look at what else Soraka does, just for comparison's sake. 

She has an AoE silence, potentially as early as level 1, but realistically at level 6, which also has the potential to stun. She has her incredible passive that also makes her heals on wheels. Her heal is on an incredibly low CDR as well. She is easier to itemize than Sona, considering her skills don't actually need much AP to be good, and thusly can just itemize for the passive support that she needs to be. Her AP ratios are better on literally every single skill, and the only level 1 stat that isn't better than Sona is her move speed, which is the same.

I can continue with the comparisons on literally every champion. Sona's supposed to be a jack-of-all-trades support with damage, peel, sustain, and utility, but is literally outperformed in at least 3 of these by every single other support in the game, and by all 4 on any champion that doesn't have a heal.

I may be biased, but my bias is still based on facts.

> The second weakest shield, base and scaling. Only Thresh's is lower base, but that is still an AoE shield, infinitely scaling, with the teammate saving component as well.

Just want to point this out, Sona has the #1 weakest shield, not 2nd.

Sona: 35/55/75/95/115 (+ 20% AP); +10/20/40 at level 6/11/16; 1.5 second duration
Thresh: 60/100/140/180/220 (+ 40% AP); 4 second duration

To beat Thresh at level 11, she needs to tag at least 2 other allies to outmatch Thresh's heal, but that's assuming herself and both of them are taking damage within that immediate 1.5 seconds.
They would have been working on this ultimate for at least a year, so this decision wasn't instant.

The only reason why she holds her 51-52% win-rate at the moment is because of the type of champ she is. As LemonInYourEyes stated, she is a fairly low skill 
champion. All of her abilities bar Crescendo are auto targeted and Crescendo alone is such a strong ability that if you land it it makes up for her otherwise lacking 
skills and base stats. Additionally, she maintains an above average win-rate because of her ability to snowball. If a Sona gets ahead and manages to get Lich 
Bane she will do high amounts of damage to the opposing ADC with her Q->Power Chord, winning her ADC the trade most of the time. While this damage is less 
than what she had before, it's still significant and to prove that she has around a 64% win-rate when she builds Lich Bane. Despite all of this she still has a weak 
heal, very little CC pre-6, and is incredibly squishy. She also gets outclassed by {{champion:40}}, {{champion:143}}, {{champion:267}},   and {{champion:25}} as a support/mage.

Saying she is not picked is a flat out lie. She is picked ALOT. Specifcally in low elo. 

Why? Because scrubs dont know how squishy she is. They take one power cord, and tink "Oh shit wtf that damage so op", and then run away and let her do whatever she wants.

In high elo, Sona is a worse version of Nami, with slightly better teamfights IF she doesnt get nuked from offhand aoe. This is also only true if Sona builds a stupid amount of AP for a supp. You cant build utility on Sona. You NEED AP.

Why does she need AP? She is worse than literally every other supp in the game if she does not build around 250+ AP. Specifcally nami can do literally everything she does better, aside from damage reduction. This means very limited choice in utility items.

The only utility items I would recommend are Banner, Ardent, and MAYBE Frostqueen. The only one I get regularly is Ardents, and that is because usually I have multiple targets who benefit from AS. Banner is only good if the enemy has aoe magic damage, or a fed katarina. You can pray banner stops her from penta'ing your team. It also gives you some good splitpush, so keep that in mind. Frostqueen is self explanatory. If a slow will actually be meaningful, buy it. If not, scrap frostfang as soon as you dont need it anymore.

You can only take 2 at the most to remain relevent/do anything that Nami couldnt do better. Ardent will usually be your best bet, and going full AP after words is kinda mandatory. 

Your gonna NEED sightstone, Lich-bane, and mobi-boots. Everything else you buy NEEDS to have AP in some form. You also need cdr.
